comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content:
That would be Mrs. Arthur Scott-Burden--she was an heiress and an equestrian champion in the 1910s.  She was formerly the Honorable Cynthia Burke Roche, of London (1884-1966); her maternal grandfather was a protegee of Cornelius Vanderbilt.  After Scott-Burden (b. 1879)  died in a 1921 polo accident, she remarried in 1922, to Guy Fairfax Cary.  

Mrs. Scott-Burden's brother, Edmund Maurice Burke Roche (1885-1955), was the grandfather of Diana Spencer.

comment._content: Speak of the devil, we have a photo on here of this fellow called Maurice Roche, might he be the same brother? www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2163448066/in/s...

comment.author: 27398485@N08
comment._content: From the New York Times 1921 - Arthur Scott Burden, brother of James A. Burden, President of the Burden Iron Works of Troy and husband of the former Cynthia, Roche, died yesterday of pneumonia at a branch of the New York Hospital in White Plains. Headline includes,  twice injured by falls from his horse

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
A Bain/LOC photo of Mrs. Burden's mother, Mrs. Burke Roche -- circulated to the Bain Agency's subscribers in 1911, after the death of Mrs. Roche's father, Frank Work. Mrs. Burden was one of the heirs:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2163454306/]
